ia.sel

Class FunctionalSelection

  • java.lang.Object
    • ia.sel.FunctionalSelection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Selection

    public class FunctionalSelection
extends java.lang.Object
implements Selection
    Enhanced version of the very simple BasicSelection. The melting-pot is replaced by the probabilistic cumulative array cumulateFitnesses. The probability can now be chosen as a real function, defined in the class. (real functions should be positive, increasing convex ones, passing by (1,1) if possible)

    • Method Detail

      • cumulativeIndex

        protected int cumulativeIndex(double[] cumulative,
                              double e)
        Selects the index of the individual corresponding to a given, random double in ]0,1[ according to the cumulative array
        Parameters:
        cumulative - the array of increasing values in ]0,1] where the interval between two values ((i-1)th, ith) gives the probability for the selection of the ith individual
        e - the random picker, which will most likely fall within the biggest (best individuals) region.
        Returns:
        the index of the corresponding individual

      • select

        public Individual[] select(Individual[] population,
                           double mutAmpl,
                           double mutProba)
        Description copied from interface: Selection
        The method called by Genetic to update his population after the previous one died. Calls the crossover method and some mutation.
        Specified by:
        select in interface Selection
        Parameters:
        population - the population to breed to create the new population
        mutAmpl - the amplitude of the mutations
        mutProba - the probability for a mutation to happen
        Returns:
        the new, hopefully better population
